paper_title.en: Occlusion of hydrogen in alkali metal-intercalated cup-stacked carbon nanofibers

description.en: Hydrogen storage in alkali metal-graphite intercalation compounds (AGICs) prepared from cup-stacked carbon nanofibers (A-CNFs, A = K, Rb and Cs) was studied by means of thermal desorption of hydrogen. The hydrogen sorbed to stage-1 K-CNFs amounts to 0.067 dm(3) (STP) per gram of carbon, most of which is fixed to KGIC as a chemical component.

paper_title.ja: シトクロム類の自己還元と電導度
アルカリ金属-カップスタックカーボンナノファイバー中への水素の吸蔵

description.en: A self-reduction of cytochrome c is found and depends on the pressure of hydrogen, pH, and sorts of buffers and salts. Cytochrome c(3) shows the two mechanisms such as the reduction of heme and hydrogen exposure effect.

paper_title.en: Occlusion of hydrogen in alkali metal-intercalated cup-stacked carbon nanofibers

description.en: Hydrogen storage in alkali metal-graphite intercalation compounds (AGICs) prepared from cup-stacked carbon nanofibers (A-CNFs, A = K, Rb and Cs) was studied by means of thermal desorption of hydrogen. The hydrogen sorbed to stage-1 K-CNFs amounts to 0.067 dm(3) (STP) per gram of carbon, most of which is fixed to KGIC as a chemical component.

paper_title.en: Hydrogen in potassium-doped carbon nanotubes studied by positron annihilation

description.en: The positron lifetime for potassium-doped carbon nanotubes (K-NTs) ascribed to positrons in trapping centers is shortened upon exposure of the K-NTs to hydrogen. Thermal desorption of hydrogen from hydrogenated K-NTs shows a peak around 510 K, where a hydrogenated potassium-graphite intercalation compound (K-GIC) shows a peak. The absorbed hydrogen is bonded with K-NTs in the same manner as found in hydrogenated K-GIC, and their positron-trapping centers are located in a more negatively charged region, such as a two-dimensional structure of hydride ions. (C) 2003 Elsevier Science Ltd. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Super van der Waals interaction of fullerenes and carbon nanotubes with rare gases and hydrogen-storage characteristics

description.en: The mass-analyzed thermal desorption and XPS for the interactions between hydrogen/rare gases and endcaps/endcaps-opened single/multi-wall carbon nanotubes as well as C-60 and C-60-Na indicate that the sites which consist of endcaps or endcaps-like structures show the characteristic and chemical bonding-like super van der Waals interaction. (C) 2002 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.ja: The characterization and magnetic properties of inorganic-organic hybrid nanocomposites, stibazoliums inserted into layered FePS3

publication_name.ja: Journal of Inclusion Phenomena and Macrocyclic Chemistry

description.en: The effect of isotopic substitution of He-3 for the He-4 occluded compounds of C-60, C-60-Na-H and carbon nanotube has been investigated by mass-analyzed thermal desorption spectroscopy. The peak temperatures of He-3 desorption bands of C-60-He-3 and C-60-Na-H-He-3 were shifted to a lower temperature than those of He-4 in C-60-H-4, and C-60-Na-H-He-4. This isotope shift is explained with the mass effect related to the interstitial diffusion of helium atoms.

paper_title.en: Characteristic bonding of rare gases in solid carbon nanotubes

description.en: He, Ne, Ar, Kr and Xe are trapped in solid carbon nanotube as well as C-60 and (NaH)(4)C-60 under the conditions of ambient temperature and pressure. The mass analyzed thermal desorption spectra are observed even above room temperature. Ar2p X-my photoelectron spectra show different chemical shift These facts suggest that rare gases have charge and are in valence state.
